result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeremy E Caruso in court, in custody with attorney Obi Uzowulu.  J J. Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Upon motion of the State case is granted to be dismissed and read-in.  Minutes filed.

Defendant Jeremy E Caruso in court, in custody with attorney Obi Uzowulu.  J J. Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Application for Jail Time Credit form
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jeremy E Caruso in court, in custody by video with attorney Jenna Proudfit for Obi Uzowulu.  Vivien L. TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 8:43 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for status conference on both files - 21CM577 and 22CM9. Record by Atty. Proudfit as to status of matters. Atty. Uzowulu received new offer yesterday and is confident matter will resolve. Court sets out as requested to next week for plea and sentencing. Court in recess.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
